thread.title: Texas Rangers win in Toronto for 2-0 ALDS lead
thread.title_full: Texas Rangers win in Toronto for 2-0 ALDS lead

author: Seattle Times staff
title: Texas Rangers win in Toronto for 2-0 ALDS lead
text:
Texas Rangers win in Toronto for 2-0 ALDS lead Originally published October 9, 2015 at 10:13 pm Rookie Hanser Alberto singled home the go-ahead run in the 14th inning and Texas beat Toronto 6-4 for a 2-0 lead in the best-of-five AL Division Series. Winning pitcher Keone Kela is a Chief Sealth High School grad who also played for Everett CC. By Seattle Times staff The Associated Press and Fort Worth Star-Telegram 
TORONTO – Backup infielder Hanser Alberto singled home the go-ahead run in the 14th inning and the Texas Rangers beat the Toronto Blue Jays 6-4 Friday for a 2-0 lead in the best-of-five American League Division Series. 
The underdog Rangers will return home and try to sweep the Blue Jays in Game 3 Sunday. Martin Perez will start for Texas against Marco Estrada. 
Reliever Keone Kela, a graduate of Chief Sealth High School in Seattle who also played at Everett Community College, was the winning pitcher. He stayed relatively calm after a dust-up with Toronto slugger Josh Donaldson that led to the benches and bullpens emptying. 
They exchanged heated words after Donaldson sent a deep foul down the left-field line. Kela struck him out and got Edwin Encarnacion with a deep fly to the wall in center to end the 13th inning. Most Read Stories Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. 
“I was just praying to God real quick that (center fielder Delino DeShields) had enough room and thankfully, by the hair on his chinny chin chin, he made (the catch),” the 22-year-old Kela said. 
Rookie Alberto, batting last and only in the lineup because standout third baseman Adrian Beltre was out with a strained back, made an error that led to Toronto’s first two runs. He delivered an RBI single with two outs in the 14th, and DeShields followed with an infield hit for another run. Royals win at home 
KANSAS CITY, Mo. – The Kansas City Royals rallied from a three-run deficit to beat the Houston Astros 5-4, evening their ALDS at a game apiece. 
Defending league champion Kansas City got a go-ahead single from Ben Zobrist in the seventh inning and then watched Wade Davis and the bullpen make it stand in a victory that brought back memories of their dramatic postseason of a year ago. 
Some clutch hitting. Stingy defense. An unflappable bullpen. 
“Just battling,” Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer said. “That’s what this team does so well.” 
Kansas City tied the score at 4 off Scott Kazmir and relievers Oliver Perez and Josh Fields in the sixth.The Royals took the lead in the seventh when Alcides Escobar led off with a triple against Will Harris (0-1) and Zobrist responded with his single through the left side. 
Kelvin Herrera (1-0) and Ryan Madson each tossed a scoreless inning; Davis came on to close it. Seattle Times staff
